intro: Echium chrysogoni, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, aiding in water retention. Echium chrysogoni is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
